slideInfo.mainText: III. Powell is unsure, doubtful about the robot. A. Powell shows he is unsure when “his brows furrowed doubtfully.” B. Syntax of fragments and dashes shows anxiety. C. Powell shows anxiety when he “repressed a sudden attack of nerves.” D. The word “safe!” in italics reveals that Powell is not really sure of the robot but that he is trying to convince himself. E. “Mathematical squiggles . . . against robot fact” exposes Powell’s lack of certainty about the machine’s capabilities.
